result.execSummary:
The defendant Domingo Lopez Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: time currently being served

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: of status conference on 06-23-2014
Per RASO - defendant has been transferred to the prison system
Defendant plans on seeking postconviction relief.

Defendant Domingo Lopez in court with attorney Diane Rose Caspari.  Defendant Domingo Lopez in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
The State is in compliance with Ch. 950. The State files an amended information. Defense acknowledges receipt and waives reading of same; NG plea entered. Upon plea to charge, the State recommends 9 mos RCJ consec to time being served.
P-NC
COP filed, rights given
the deft waives right to JT
the State relies on comp for FB - defense stipulates to same
finding of guilt

BTC: guilty as above. 6 mos RCJ-consec to time currently being served, costs

ADDRESS INFO for Domingo Lopez Jr
Current: c/o Racine County Jail 717 Wisconsin Ave, Racine, WI 53403   (Effective: 07-28-2015)
Prior: 2264 Loni Lane, Mount Pleasant, WI 53406
ZCI
For defendant to come from Dodge to court on 07-28-2015.
ZCI

Defendant Domingo Lopez in court with attorney Diane Rose Caspari.  Defendant Domingo Lopez in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
The State is in compliance with Ch. 950. Parties have reviewed PSI, jail disciplinary records, and letter from victim's father. No additions or corrections noted by parties. The State recommends 25 yrs WPS bifurcated as 10 yrs IC, 15 yrs ES. Defense is asking for 7-8 yrs IC, 10 or more years ES. 

BTC: Total sentence is 25 yrs WPS bifurcated as 15 yrs IC, 10 yrs ES/CFTS

Conditions:
obey all rules and regs
costs
DNA sample & costs
no alc/cs except by Rx-UA's
any counseling deemed approp by agent; speficially sex offender counseling
must register with SORP and follow all rules and regs
no contact with victim, directly or indirectly, without victim approval and approval of agent
no contact with anyone under 18 witout prior written approval of agent and parents of children
FT emp
be compliant with any CHIPS or any family court orders
FAW/vote

NOT eligible for CIP. IS eligible for SAP

In 14CF455, STC to be set

Defendant Domingo Lopez in court with attorney Diane Rose Caspari.  Defendant Domingo Lopez in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
There has been compliance with Ch. 950. The State files amended information in 14CF168. Defense acknowledges receipt of same and enters NG plea. Upon pleas to 14CF168-Ct 5, balance DRI. 14CF177 and 13CF1469 are DRI. The State recommends 25 yrs WPS bifurcated as 10 yrs IC, 15 yrs ES with approp conditions.
P-NC
COP filed, rights given
the deft waives right to JT
the State relies on comp for FB - defense stipulates to same
finding of guilt

Defense asks that the bond be modified to allow deft to have visits and telephone contact with Lisa Lopez and Michelle Lopez. The State does not object to lifting no contact with Lisa Lopez, but no contact should remain with Michelle Lopez. 

BTC: guilty as above. PSI ordered. Modify bond to allow contact with Lisa Lopez, but defendant must not communicate with Michell Lopez

Defendant Domingo Lopez in court with attorney Diane Rose Caspari.  Defendant Domingo Lopez in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Motion for second reconsideration has been decided and is denied. Ms. Caspari makes a record regarding decision of the Court regarding the second reconsideration. The Court has received the motion to suppress, response from Mr. Repischak and Ms. Caspari's reply to the State's letter in opposition to suppression. 
The State is unaware of what corrections officer went into defendant's cell or why and therefore, they are not subpoenae'd for today. It is the State's belief that the expectation of privacy in terms of the jail makes little distinction between someone waiting for their case to be resolved and someone sitting on a sentence.

The State objects to the jury hearing the DVD's because they contain information regarding the other children. 

BTC: The Court denies the State's summary motion to deny to suppress. The State is to be prepared to present testimony as to why the corrections officers entered the defendant's cell. Ms. Caspari is to notify the State of specifically what was taken.  Motion hearing scheduled for March 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Domingo Lopez in court with attorney Diane Rose Caspari.  Defendant Domingo Lopez in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
defense files motion this morning intending to use DVD. Defense has filed motion to suppress evidence and motion for second reconsideration. No outstanding issues in the State's perspective. No other legal issues in the Defense perspective. Ms. Caspari now indicates that she may not be available 3/9. Parties are to have any witnesses they plan on producing here and ready to go. Parties are expecting to handle motions Monday afternoon. The Court will defer ruling on MIL Monday. The State asks that the matter of video tape/DVD be addressed on Monday. The State will provide a copy to the Court. The State indicates that there were a number of letters seized from deft that are in the State's possession that defense has not seen. Ms. Caspari indicates she wants a copy of the letters. 
The motion to reconsider involves the witness in Florida and asks that the matter be heard today.

BTC: MH date remains. The Court is satisfied Ms. Defense will make copies and have them in her possession before Tuesday. Motion for second reconsideration is summarily denied. There was NO misstatement on the record by Mr. Repischak or his witness. The Court finds no basis for sanctioning the State. The State is to prepare an order to this effect.

Defendant Domingo Lopez in court with attorney Diane Rose Caspari.  Defendant Domingo Lopez in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
The State forwarded a global offer to counsel yesterday. Ms. Caspari indicates they have gone over the plea offer and made a counter offer which the State declined. Defense asks for JT on 14cf168.  The State's case in chief will take a day and a half. Defense anticipates 1 day.  Status conference scheduled for March 6, 2015 at 09:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for March 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Domingo Lopez in court with attorney Diane Rose Caspari.  Defendant Domingo Lopez in custody.  Robert S. Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
The Court has reviewed the defense filings as well as the response by the State. Parties put arguments on the record.
The Court had conference with parties in chambers regarding letter.

BTC: Defense motion is denied. The State may give a cutoff date of the event but may not use the term 'prison'.  The request for in camera inspection is denied. The Court is not provided enough information to decide the request of the expert as presented by defense

The defense is to provided the following information to the State
basis and reason
facts/data considered in forming opinion
exhibits to be used
qualifications including publications authored 
transcripts of experts previous testimony
compensation

This is to be provided to the State within 30 days of today's date, October 13, 2014 by 5 pm central time  Motion hearing scheduled for October 27, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Domingo Lopez in court with attorney Diane Rose Caspari.  Defendant Domingo Lopez in custody.  Robert S. Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Ms. Caspari has filed motions and witness list as requested by the Court at a previous hearing including a special discovery demand. The State needs time to review the motions that were filed. State indicates that there will need a Daubert hearing as well as a Schiffra-Green motion. The State indicates that the global offer is now withdrawn.

BTC: JT is off. The Court acknowledges the State's offer is withdrawn

Defendant Domingo Lopez in court with attorney Diane Rose Caspari.  Defendant Domingo Lopez in custody.  Robert S. Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
State has filed an other acts motion along with a brief which has been reviewed by the Court. Defense does not believe the other acts motion does not reach the legal standards to allow the other acts.

Defense calls LL - DSAT. Direct by the Defense. No cross xam by the State.
The State calls Inv. Don Vandervest. Direct by the State. 
Ms. Caspari objects to the use of Inv. Vandervest's report and indicates she didn't see it until today. The State indicates it is always available in their file and it was used as a basis for this motion had defense wished to view it. The Court takes a break to allow Ms. Caspari to review the report.
Back on the record at 2:26 pm. The State recalls Inv. Vandervest. Direct continues. Cross xam by defense.
Defense recalls LL-still under oath. Cross xam by the State. Defense recalls Inv. Vandervest. Still under oath. Direct by the Defense. Nothing further from the State.

Defense intends to file a motion to reconsider

BTC: The Court grants the State's other acts motion. In light of defense request for motion to reconsider, The Court will give jury instructin #275  Motion hearing scheduled for September 12, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Domingo Lopez in court with attorney Diane R Caspari.  Defendant Domingo Lopez in custody.  Robert S Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Sandra Campbell.
Def req JT in 14CF168.  State withdraws all offers.  Defense req Ludwig hearing.

  Jury trial scheduled for September 30, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 5, 2014 at 09:00 am.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 25, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Back on record 9:42.  Defendant has been returned to RCJ.
Atty Caspari states that defendant would still like time to consider offer.
State will reinstate offer.
BTC:  If defendant wants to take offer, defense must notify the State by 8/15/14.
Status conference scheduled for June 23, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Diane Caspari
Pre-trial conference on May 2, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Reading waived.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 05-02-2014 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Domingo Lopez in court, in custody,  with attorney Andrew M. Meetz.  Robert S. Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.
Waiver of preliminary hearing not based on offer.
Information filed; reading waived.  
Not guilty plea entered. 
BTC: Bound over
Andrew Meetz
Preliminary hearing on April 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family).  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Domingo Lopez in court with attorney Michelle Marie Anderson.  Defendant Domingo Lopez in custody.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court Reporter: Lori Thornton.    Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.
